meta.title: Home - PWr In Space
meta.description: PWr in Space is a students association that brings together enthusiasts of rockets, space technology and space exploration. Helps develop interests and gather experience. Students from different departments are brought together by a common passion. Currently, one of the projects is PoliWRocket, where we are building the R5 rocket. Powered by a hybrid engine, which will take part in the international Spaceport America Cup 2023 competition in the United States.

landingSection.title: PWR IN SPACE
landingSection.description: Students Association of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering at the Wroclaw University of Technology

aboutUs.text: PWr in Space is a students association that brings together enthusiasts of rockets, space technology and space exploration. Helps develop interests and gather experience. Students from different departments are brought together by a common passion. Currently, one of the projects is PoliWRocket, where we are building the R5 rocket. Powered by a hybrid engine, which will take part in the international Spaceport America Cup 2023 competition in the United States. This is not only a student competition, but also a scientific conference and an opportunity to make friends with team members from around the world.

R1.name: MICRO
R1.description: The first rocket created by PWr in Space. The construction was a mix of cardboard with fiberglass for the fuselages and carbon fiber for the fins. The head was created with a 3D printer. The purpose of this rocket was to learn how to make rockets - designing, making and assembling, and for this reason the engine was purchased.

R2.name: SETKA
R2.description: Meaning "A hundred (100)" in Polish, it was a test rocket designed for cheap and quick testing of components for the larger R3 rocket. The first PWr in Space's engine, "Engine A," with a thrust of 450 N, a length of 354 mm and a diameter of 45 mm, was designed and manufactured for the rocket. Various recovery and electronic systems were tested during the rocket lifespan.

R3.name: DZIEWIĘĆDZIESIĄTKA DZIEWIĄTKA
R3.description: The first rocket created for the 2019 Spaceport America Cup competition, the rocket was equipped with "Engine B". - hybrid rocket engine with a thrust of 1600 N, whose oxidizer was a nitrous oxide and fuel was a polypropylene. A two-stage recovery system was made, which enabled the rocket to return safely to Earth, allowing the team to take 5th place with an apogee of 4,200 meters. The name translates to "Ninety Nine" in Polish.

R2S.name: BLUE DRAGON
R2S.description: Another test rocket, and a chance for newcomers to learn how to build a rocket from start to completion. The design is based on the R2 rocket, and we managed to utilize unused R3 spare fuselages to create its fuselage. Equipped with a solid fuel engine, the rocket flew at the "Experimental Rocket Flights" event organized annually by the Polish Rocket Society.

R4S.name: LYNX (test rocket)
R4S.description: A test rocket, created for testing modules and solutions for the next R4 rocket. The rocket allowed testing of the ACS active flight control module, as well as the new electronics and recovery system. The rocket made two flights - at the LRE and the Meteor Festival.

R4.name: LYNX
R4.description: A rocket with a hybrid engine, "Engine C," powered by nitrous oxide and aluminum epoxy resin. Lynx flew at the European Rocketry Challenge 2021 in Portugal. At an apogee of about 2,700 meters, the team won 2nd place in the 3k Hybrid SRAD category and the "Best Design" award for the best design implementation of all the teams at the competition.

R4V2.name: PINK PANTHER
R4V2.description: The rocket was an improvement of its predecessor R4, receiving the same hybrid engine. Previous design flaws were corrected, and solutions were optimized. The rocket competed at the Spaceport America Cup 2022 in New Mexico, where our team won 2nd place in its 10k Hybrid, Liquid&Others category.

R5.name: AURORA
R5.description: In Aurora, changes were made to the structure of the rocket and its cylinder. The electronic system was modified as well. On top of that, the main computer was rebuilt, and a brand new 12-meter launcher was created. The rocket participated in the Spaceport America Cup 2023 in New Mexico, where our team won 2nd place in its 10k SRAD Hybrid category.

firstParagraph.title: INTRO
firstParagraph.subtitle: OUR STORY
firstParagraph.text: PWr in Space students scientific association was founded in 2017, when a dozen people came together with a shared love of space. The first rocket made by the founding team was the R1 Micro, which was only 750 mm and 0.8 kg. In addition to the technical work done in the organization, from the beginning the students were eager to participate in conferences, workshops and training sessions, which gave them the opportunity to learn about new companies, organizations and their modern manufacturing solutions. Thanks to the commitment of the members of PWr in Space, it was possible to gain interest of sponsors and encourage them to cooperate. After just two years of painstaking work and acquiring the necessary knowledge, we managed to go to the first Spaceport America Cup competition in the United States, in which we took 5th place. For such a young team, this was a great honor. This is how the organization's adventure with competitions and competition with teams from all over the world began.

secondParagraph.title: ABOUT US
secondParagraph.subtitle: WHO WE ARE
secondParagraph.text: Currently, several dozen people are active in PWr in Space, implementing three projects: PoliWRocket, PoliFloater and PoliPlane. They are utilizing modern technologies in software, composite materials, 3D printing and material sintering. The scientific association has developed innovative solutions over these several years of activity, which are appreciated by judges at international competitions or companies in the space industry. These include a hybrid engine, a system for actively controlling the trajectory of a rocket in flight, or the use of a winder to create rotating solids. Although the circle itself is based at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, it brings together students from all over Wroclaw University of Technology. Our latest and most ambitious project was the construction of a hybrid-powered R5 rocket, capable of reaching an apogee of 3048 meters (10000 feet) and lifting a payload of at least 4 kilograms. These numbers are not coincidental, and refer to the competition in which the R5 rocket competed and succeeded, such as 2rd place at the aforementioned SAC 2023 competition. All modules and components of the rocket, including the engine, critical electronics, launch structure or recovery module, were carefully designed and manufactured by us.

airframe.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ JUNIOR COMPOSITE LAMINATION SPECIALIST 
Position description:
- workshop work, 
- lamination of carbon and glass composites,
- CFD simulations,
- modeling of parts in 3D programs. 
➡️ WIND TUNNEL DESIGNER 
Position description:
- workshop work,
- fundamentals of mechanics and electronics, 
- simple CFD simulations, 
- research skills.
➡️ COMPOSITE WINDER BUILDER 
Position description:
- Completion and configuration of a carbon fiber winder.

engines.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ MECHANICAL COMPONENTS DESIGNER
Requirements: 
- A head on your shoulders and self-reliance.
Position description: 
- Design of mechanical components - from concept to strength calculations and prototype testing, 
- workshop work and field trips for static testing.
Useful skills: 
- CAD/CAM software operation, 
- workshop skills, 
- basic knowledge of strength of materials, manufacturing techniques, thermodynamics, 
- ability to develop simple scripts, e.g. in Python/MATLAB.

pr.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ COPYWRITER
- Running social media, keeping an eye on the latest trends,
- writing posts and promotional texts,
- liaising with graphic designer, 
- running marketing campaigns.
➡️ CONTENT CREATOR 
- communicativeness, charisma, ingenuity,
- marketing promotion of the circle, looking for sponsors, observing the market, 
- public speaking, interviews, lectures, conducting meetings,
- social media content creation. 
➡️ GRAPHIC DESIGNER JUNIOR
- Ability to process promotional materials (photos, videos),
- basic knowledge of graphic editors (e.g. Photoshop, Figma),
- creativity, high level of aesthetics, accuracy, 
- willingness to create interesting content.
Uwaga❗️Kandydaci to the PR & Marketing Department at the 1st stage of recruitment have a different task than technical departments.

webdev.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ JUNIOR WEB DEVELOPER 
Requirements: 
- JavaScript basics (React.js),
- knowledge of Git and the GitHub platform,
- willingness to learn how to write websites.

payload.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ JUNIOR RESEARCH CARGO SPECIALIST
➡️ JUNIOR LABSAT DESIGNER

recovery.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ JUNIOR SPECIALIST CONSTRUCTOR 
Requirements: 
- experience with CAD/CAM modeling, 
- basic knowledge of manufacturing techniques (technological nature of designed components).
➡️ JUNIOR MECHATRONICS SPECIALIST
Requirements:
- knowledge of mechatronics (with emphasis on mechanics and electronics),
- ability to design mechatronic systems, 
- Experience with pneumatics welcome.
➡️ JUNIOR MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST 
Requirements: 
- knowledge of manufacturing techniques, 
- basic knowledge of the principles of mechanical parts design.

electronics.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ EMBEDDED DEVELOPER 
Requirements:
- microcontroller programming, 
- soldering, 
- PCB design.
➡️ JAVA PROGRAMMER 
Requirements:
- object-oriented programming,
- design patterns, 
- clean code. 
Knowledge of other technologies and ability to work with web development welcome.

acs.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ AUTOMATICS  
A person who wants to explore information about: 
- control systems, 
- PID controllers,
- filters.
Knowledge of advanced mathematics and physics is welcome.

polifloater.text:
Who we are looking for: 
➡️ ATMOSPHERIC PROBE CONSTRUCTION PERSON 
Requirements: 
- knowledge in the area of ham radio, 
- interest in stratospheric balloons. 
Willingness to explore the topic of antennas and various long-distance digital wireless communication systems is welcome.
